title: Raising awareness for an invisible disease
body:
Hi everyone! So I was recently diagnosed with a debilitating disease a few months ago. It has left me wheelchair bound and jobless since I can no longer stand and be a baker. Im going to start streaming to raise awareness for POTS, I thought it would be really cool to enjoy my favorite hobby and to raise awareness so more people will understand more about this Chronic illness and find a cure one day. Once I get the money to build a better computer I will start streaming. It will take me awhile since I no longer have a job but its the one dream I have left that I can do.

For those who wish to donate and help me out here's a link gofundme.com/lmp8oc

Here is a link to my twitch I hope it works. twitch.tv/xbabycakessx

Something interesting I found:
*"The longest follow-up study done to date comes from Mayo Clinic.20 Mayo Clinic did a survey of their pediatric POTS patients seen between 2003 and 2010. Of those who responded to the survey, 18.2% reported a complete resolution of their POTS symptoms, while 52.8% reported persistent but improved symptoms. Male patients were twice as likely to report recovery. The average survey respondent had been diagnosed for about 5 years. Both patients who fully recovered and those who did not had mental health scores similar to the national norm. "*
http://www.dysautonomiainternational.org/page.php?ID=30
It also discusses treatment, not sure what your doc may have recommended. It looks like you actually have rather decent odds of it not weighing you down your entire life.

Well also my dr won't sign the work release form because I'm a hazard at work. I can't lift my hands over my head to put trays in the oven or carry heavy boxes, my work doesn't want to risk me getting hurt. The thing with pots is that it's caused by a lot of different issues. (Auto immune diseases, flu, mono, body trauma from accidents and so many more) also everyone's case varies some can stand for hours, other mere minutes and some can't even sit up out of bed without fainting. Beta blockers work for some but for others makes it worse. Florinef worked for some but made my symptoms so much worse. I think it depends on your underlining cause. I believe mine is caused by an auto immune disease since it runs in the family. I hope this is just a flare of the auto immune disease making my pots worse. I Found a new dr who is taking a different route and I hope his plan works for me but only time will tell!

What is pots exactly?

> [{quoted}](name=rekt522,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=AZJdEUpe,comment-id=0036,timestamp=2015-02-07T17:31:51.134+0000)
>
> What is pots exactly?

Pots is a nervous system disorder that causes your system to misfire and doesn't signal to your veins when you change positions (sitting, standing) so unlike a normal person when I sit or stand my blood pools at my lower half of the body. That causes my heart to work extra hard so my heart rate can go to 130+ beats. With prolonged standing (5 minutes) it causes me to faint and my heart to stop for a few seconds. There are plenty of other symptoms that are very frustrating such as extreme fatigue, sleeping problems, shortness of breath, memory loss, and many many more. Thank you for asking!
